page.title: 19Changes in Milk Production
page.content: Twenty five years ago in Chapel Allerton there were 24 farms producing milk but now there are only three. Manor Farm is one of these. The cows were multi-purpose shorthorns and were milked by hand. It took 4 men to milk the 80 cows then but now with machines to help only one man is needed. The shorthorns have been replaced by Friesians and the milk is stored in large containers and not collected daily in churns.In the Winter the cows were kept in pens and fed with hay, but now they stay in large cubicles and are fed with silage,cowcake and beet. Mangols were grown in the fields 25 years ago and the weeds were kept clear by a man with a push hoe.Now weed killers are used and a greater variety of crops are grown.
